TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_E_06 Template
TestCase.Purpose: Positive test verifying the eID-Client to support all cipher suites and parameters listed in the ICS.
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The cipher suites listed in the ICS are conform to the [TR-03124-1].
Choose one of the cipher suites listed in the ICS.

Command.Text: Verify that the eID-Client does not support any other cipher suites as listed in the ICS.

TestStep.Description: [TC_TOKEN_URL] is a valid https-URL where the TC Token can be retrieved by the eID-Client.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client is activated and starts establishment of channel TLS-1-2 to the TC Token Provider.

The eID-Client offers a TLS version conforming to [TR-03124-1]. Furthermore, the eID-Client only offers cipher suites and respective parameters (signature algorithms, domain parameters and key lengths) listed in the ICS.

Command.Text: The TC Token Provider accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The TC Token Provider uses the chosen cipher suite and respective parameters (TLS version, domain parameters and key lengths) listed in the ICS of the eID-Client.

According to the testing parameters and cipher suite, the TC Token Provider uses either TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_L], [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_M] or [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_N] from [CERT_SET_3].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client submits a HTTP GET to [TC_TOKEN_URL] via the channel TLS-1-2.

Command.Text: Check if the eID-Client requests the TC Token via the provided URL and respond to the eID-Client with a valid TC Token.

TestStep.Description: The HTTP response containing TC Token has "Content-Type: text/xml" and "charset=utf-8". The response does not contain any further content besides TC Token.
TC Token contains the default parameters.
Parameter "PSK" is randomly set to value [PSK].
Parameter "SessionIdentifier" is randomly set to value [SID].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client starts establishment of channel TLS-2 to the eID-Server.

The eID-Client offers a TLS version conforming to [TR-03124-1]. Furthermore, the eID-Client only offers the cipher suites and respective parameters (signature algorithms, domain parameters and key lengths) listed in the ICS.

Command.Text: The eID-Server accepts the connection TLS-2 based on [PSK].

TestStep.Description: The eID-Server uses the chosen cipher suite and respective parameters (TLS version, domain parameters and key lengths) listed in the ICS of the eID-Client.
The eID-Server uses TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_3_A] from [CERT_SET_3].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Server receives the message "StartPAOS" via connection TLS-2.

Command.Text: Perform Online Authentication in analogy to .

ExpectedResult.Text: After Online-Authnetication, the eID-Client starts establishment of channel TLS-1-2 to the server of the "RefreshAddress".

The eID-Client offers a TLS version conforming to [TR-03124-1]. Furthermore, the eID-Client only offers cipher suites and respective parameters (signature algorithms, domain parameters and key lengths) listed in the ICS.

Command.Text: The server accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The server uses the same cipher suite and respective parameters (TLS version, domain parameters and key lengths) and certificate as in the first TLS-1-2 connection.

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS-1-2 channel is successfully established by the eID-Client.
